courses.name: Introduction to Industrial Engineering
courses.description: Introduction to industrial engineering profession, the Industrial and Manufacturing Systems Engineering department, and the core topics of industrial engineering. Introduction to problem solving, ethics and industrial engineering design and analysis techniques.

courses.name: Experimental Course
courses.description: For freshman-level students. Content and credit to be listed in the Schedule of Courses.

courses.name: Undergraduate Seminar
courses.description: Seminars are held monthly to provide a forum for departmental communication of upcoming opportunities (jobs, speakers, deadlines, etc.), speakers from industry to provide educational context, and student interaction. Required every semester of enrollment for graduation. Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Fundamentals of Systems Design and Analysis
courses.description: Develop an understanding of a systems approach to the design and operation of modern industrial organizations: systems structure and function, system specification, structured problem solving and system design methodology.

courses.name: Probability and Statistics for Engineers
courses.description: Introduction to data analysis, probability concepts, random variables, parameter estimation and hypothesis testing.
courses.prerequisites: MATH 1500. Restricted to Engineering Students who are non-IMSE majors

courses.name: Linear Algebra for Engineers
courses.description: Study of quantitative methods necessary for analysis, modeling and design of optimal industrial systems.

courses.name: Introduction to Information Technologies
courses.description: A survey of current technologies and their use.  Different technologies will be reviewed. Examples: web search strategies, common application tools, searching and sorting on the WWW, upcoming trends and directions in information technologies. This is a web-based self-study course with instructor's guidance.

courses.name: Engineering Economic Analysis
courses.description: Fundamentals of engineering economic decision making.  Includes time value of money, breakeven analysis, capital budgeting, replacement, after-tax analysis, inflation, risk, sensitivity analysis and multi-attribute analysis.

courses.name: Performance Measurement and Ergonomics
courses.description: Design of man-machine systems considering capabilities and limitations of the human component. Method of measuring human performance in man-machine systems; includes lab.

courses.name: Topics in Industrial and Manufacturing Systems Engineering
courses.description: Current and new technical developments in industrial engineering.  May be repeated to 6 hours.

courses.name: Manufacturing and Supply Systems
courses.description: Provide a structured approach for the design and optimization of a system throughout its lifecycle: techniques following the logical sequence of strategic analysis, system design, implementation, and monitoring.

courses.name: Probability Models for Engineers
courses.description: Introduction to probability concept and theory, random variables, discrete and continuous probability distributions, joint probability distributions.
courses.prerequisites: MATH 1500. Restricted to IMSE students only

courses.name: Ergonomics and Workstation Design
courses.description: Ergonomics and human factors theories applied to the design of man-machine systems.  Discussion of ergonomic methods for measurement, assessment, and evaluation, with major topics including workstation design, environmental stresses, and workplace safety.  Includes lab.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to IMSE students and ENGINR 1200

courses.name: Ergonomics and Workstation Design - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Ergonomics and human factors theories applied to the design of man-machine systems.  Discussion of ergonomic methods for measurement, assessment, and evaluation, with major topics including workstation design, environmental stresses, and workplace safety.  Includes lab.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to IMSE students and ENGINR 1200

courses.name: Topics in Industrial and Manufacturing Systems Engineering
courses.description: Current and new technical developments in industrial engineering.

courses.name: Problems in Industrial Engineering
courses.description: Supervised investigation in industrial engineering presented in form of an engineering report.

courses.name: Engineering Statistics
courses.description: Understanding and application of statistical analysis techniques. Emphasis on hypothesis testing, regression analysis, analysis of variance (ANOVA) and design of experiments (DOE).
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to IMSE students or by Departmental consent. Grade of C- or better in IMSE 3110

courses.name: Linear Optimization
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 7210). Theory and application of linear optimization.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to IMSE students. Grade of C- or better in IMSE 2210

courses.name: Optimization Modeling and Computational Methods
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 7220). Modeling and solution techniques for mathematical optimization, including linear, nonlinear, integer, and stochastic programming. Emphasis on formulation of models for most-efficient use of solution algorithms.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Operations Research Models
courses.description: Formulates probabilistic models and determines optimal control policies for queuing and inventory systems. Introduces Markov chains and dynamic programming.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to IMSE students or by Departmental consent. Grade of C- or better in IMSE 2210 and IMSE 3110

courses.name: Systems Simulation
courses.description: Discrete-event stochastic systems modeling and experimentation using simulation software.  Statistical design and analysis including distribution fitting and alternative comparison methodologies.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to IMSE students.  INFOTC 1040 or CMP_SC 1050.  Grade of C- or better in IMSE 4110

courses.name: Integrated Production Systems Design
courses.description: Design and operation of production systems, including lean six sigma concepts, just-in-time/kanban, facility layout and material flow issues.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to IMSE students or by Departmental consent. IMSE 4210, IMSE 4280

courses.name: Material Flow and Logistics System Design
courses.description: Modeling and analysis of structural and operational issues associated with material-flow system design including facility location, warehouse/inventory systems, and distribution/transportation systems.

courses.name: Production and Operations Analysis
courses.description: Quantitative methods for forecasting, scheduling, and production control in manufacturing and service systems. Use of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to IMSE students or by Departmental consent. IMSE 4210 and IMSE 4230

courses.name: Supply Chain Engineering
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 7360). Modeling and analysis of supply chain network design and management issues including integration of production, inventory control, supplier selection, risk management and logistics network design. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Six Sigma Methodology
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 7380). An overview of the Six Sigma DMAIC methodology for analyzing and improving processes. Requires completing a Six Sigma Green Belt project. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C or better in IMSE 2110 or IMSE 4110 or STAT 4710

courses.name: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Project
courses.description: Application of the Lean Six Sigma methodology in an industry-based project.

courses.name: Management Information Systems Design
courses.description: MIS concepts and management issues, HTML for web pages and eShop (front-office operations), back-office operations using relational databases, introduction to SQL.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to IMSE students. INFOTC 1040 or CMP_SC 1050 and junior standing required

courses.name: Web-Based Information Systems
courses.description: Data models, design of databases using E-R, UML (Access/Oracle), web databases, web servers and interfaces (Visual Basic, JavaScript), E-commerce infrastructure (PDM, STEP, XML), data mining for management information and services.

courses.name: Computer Aided Design and Manufacturing
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 7550).  Product realization process from design, process planning, to manufacturing. Includes CE, DFS/DFM, CAD, CAPP, CNC, and survey of manufacturing methods.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to IMSE students; Junior Standing

courses.name: Introduction to Rapid Prototyping
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 4560). Course covers all five MU systems: FDM, SLS, SLA, Polyjet, 3DP.  Students will learn fundamental rapid prototyping and related concepts, and design and produce models from each system.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Computer Integrated Manufacturing Control
courses.description: Implementation of computer integrated manufacturing (CIM) and automation at the shop floor level. Covers essential components of machine sensing and actuation (including programmable robots), information representation and processing, data communication and networking.

courses.name: Industrial Energy Efficiency and Management
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 7580). Introduction to the fundamentals of industrial energy efficiency and management. Covers the essential concepts, best practices, management systems and current standards to achieve and improve energy efficiency in industrial settings, and utilizes hands-on experiences involving real assessment and analysis of industrial site visits and projects.

courses.name: Engineering Quality Control
courses.description: Analysis of quality in manufacturing including control charts, sampling plans, process capability, experimental design; introduction to system reliability.  Overview of Six Sigma and DMAIC methodology.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to IMSE students or by Departmental consent. IMSE 4110

courses.name: Entrepreneurial Innovation Management: Enterprise Conception
courses.description: (same as MANGMT 4750). Develop a new business and technology plan including marketing, finance, engineering, manufacturing, and production concepts in this joint College of Engineering and College of Business course.

courses.name: Entrepreneurial Innovation Management: Enterprise Conception-Honors
courses.description: Develop a new business and technology plan including marketing, finance, engineering, manufacturing, and production concepts in this joint College of Engineering and College of Business course.

courses.name: Entrepreneurial Innovation Management: Enterprise Design
courses.description: (same as MANGMT 4760). Expand on IMSE 4750 business/technology plan into an operations plan; advertising facilities layout, selling and distribution channels, product designs, accounting procedures, manufacturing processes, and prototypes.

courses.name: Entrepreneurial Innovation Management: Enterprise Design-Honors
courses.description: (same as MANGMT 4765H). Expand on IMSE 4755H business/technology plan into an operations plan; advertising facilities layout, selling and distribution channels, product designs, accounting procedures, manufacturing processes, and prototypes.

courses.name: Entrepreneurial Innovation Management: Enterprise  Operations
courses.description: (same as MANGMT 4770). Perform the day-to-day operations for an enterprise by managing all business processes including finance, manufacturing, sales and delivery.

courses.name: Entrepreneurial Innovation Management: Enterprise Operations-Honors
courses.description: Perform the day-to-day operations for an enterprise by managing all business processes including finance, manufacturing, sales and delivery.

courses.name: Cognitive Ergonomics
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 7810). This course will cover the study of empirical research in Cognitive ergonomics and Human-Computer Interaction (HCI). Students will learn cognitive information processing, mental workload, human reliability, and empirical methods in HCI research. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.recommendation: Junior or senior level undergraduate students

courses.name: Industrial Engineering Internship
courses.description: An industry-based learning experience that provides opportunities to apply industrial engineering skills, concepts and theories in a practical context. Requires submission of an internship plan for prior approval and a final oral presentation / written report at the completion of the internship. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Industrial Engineering COOP
courses.description: An industry-based learning experience that provides opportunities to apply industrial engineering skills, concepts and theories in a practical context. Requires submission of a COOP plan for prior approval and a final oral presentation / written report at the completion of the COOP. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Capstone Design I
courses.description: Overview of professional engineering issues such as ethics, team dynamics, communication, and project management.  Includes team-based industrial assessments to develop skills in problem/opportunity identification.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to IMSE students; Senior Standing, IMSE 2030; IMSE 2710

courses.name: Capstone Design I - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Overview of professional engineering issues such as ethics, team dynamics, communication, and project management.  Includes team-based industrial assessments to develop skills in problem/opportunity identification.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to IMSE students; Senior Standing, IMSE 2030; IMSE 2710

courses.name: Capstone Design II
courses.description: Industry-based team design experience structured to integrate material presented throughout the Industrial and Manufacturing Systems Engineering curriculum.  Must immediately follow IMSE 4970.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to IMSE student; IMSE 3810, IMSE 4310, and  IMSE 4970

courses.name: Capstone Design II - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Industry-based team design experience structured to integrate material presented throughout the Industrial and Manufacturing Systems Engineering curriculum.  Must immediately follow IMSE 4970.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to IMSE student;. IMSE 3810, IMSE 4310, and  IMSE 4970

courses.name: Undergraduate Research in Industrial Engineering
courses.description: Independent investigation or project in industrial engineering. May be repeated to 6 hours.

courses.name: Undergraduate Research Industrial Engineering - Honors
courses.description: Independent investigation or project in industrial engineering. May be repeated to 6 hours. Enrollment limited to receiving departmental honors

courses.name: Topics in Industrial and Manufacturing Systems Engineering
courses.description: Current and new technical developments in industrial engineering.

courses.name: Engineering Statistics
courses.description: Understanding and application of statistical analysis of techniques.  Emphasis on hypothesis testing, regression analysis, analysis of variance (ANOVA) and design of experiments (DOE).
courses.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in IMSE 3110

courses.name: Linear Optimization
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 4210). Theory and application of linear optimization.

courses.name: Optimization Modeling and Computational Methods
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 4220). Modeling and solution techniques for mathematical optimization, including linear, nonlinear, integer, and stochastic programming. Emphasis on formulation of models for most-efficient use of solution algorithms.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Operations Research Models
courses.description: Formulates probabilistic models and determines optimal control policies for queuing and inventory systems. Introduces Markov chains and dynamic programming.
courses.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in  IMSE 2110 and IMSE 3110

courses.name: Systems Simulation
courses.description: Discrete-event stochastic systems modeling and experimentation using simulation software.  Statistical design and analysis including distribution fitting and alternative comparison methodologies.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in IMSE 4110, INFOTC 1040 or CMP_SC 1050

courses.name: Integrated Production Systems Design
courses.description: Design and operation of production systems, including lean production concepts, just-in-time / kanban, facility layout and material flow issues.

courses.name: Material Flow and Logistics System Design
courses.description: Modeling and analysis of structural and operational issues associated with material-flow system design including facility location, warehouse/inventory systems, and distribution/transportation systems.

courses.name: Production and Operations Analysis
courses.description: Quantitative methods for forecasting, scheduling, and production control in manufacturing and service systems. Use of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems.

courses.name: Supply Chain Engineering
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 4360). Modeling and analysis of supply chain network design and management issues including integration of production, inventory control, supplier selection, risk management and logistics network design. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Six Sigma Methodology
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 4380).  An overview of the Six Sigma DMAIC methodology for analyzing and improving processes. Requires completing a Six Sigma Green Belt project. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C or better in IMSE 2110 or IMSE 4110 or STAT 4710

courses.name: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Project
courses.description: Application of the Lean Six Sigma methodology in an industry-based project.

courses.name: Management Information Systems Design
courses.description: MIS concepts and management issues, HTML for web pages and eShop (front office operation), back-office operations using relational databases, introduction for SQL. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Web-Based Information Systems
courses.description: Data models, design of databases using E-R, UML (Access/Oracle), web databases, web servers and interfaces (Visual Basic, JavaScript), E-commerce infrastructure (PDM, STEP, XML), data mining for management information and services.

courses.name: Computer Aided Design and Manufacturing
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 4550). Product realization process from design, process planning, to manufacturing. Includes CE, DFS/DFM, CAD, CAPP, CNC, and survey of manufacturing methods.

courses.name: Introduction to Rapid Prototyping
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 4560). Course covers all five MU systems: FDM, SLS, SLA, Polyjet, 3DP. Students will learn fundamental rapid prototyping and related concepts, and design and produce models from each system. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Computer Integrated Manufacturing Control
courses.description: Implementation of computer integrated manufacturing (CIM) and automation at the shop floor level. Covers essential components of machine sensing and actuation (including programmable robots), information representation and processing, data communication and networking.

courses.name: Industrial Energy Efficiency and Management
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 4580). Introduction to the fundamentals of industrial energy efficiency and management. Covers the essential concepts, best practices, management systems and current standards to achieve and improve energy efficiency in industrial settings, and utilizes hands-on experiences involving real assessment and analysis of industrial site visits and projects.

courses.name: Engineering Quality Control
courses.description: Analysis of quality in manufacturing including control charts, sampling plans, process capability, experimental design; introduction to system reliability. Overview of Six Sigma and DMAIC methodology.

courses.name: Entrepreneurial Innovation Management: Advanced Enterprise Conception
courses.description: Develop a new business and technology plan (including marketing, finance, engineering, manufacturing, and production concepts) in this joint College of Engineering/College of Business course.

courses.name: Entrepreneurial Innovation Management: Advanced Enterprise Design
courses.description: Expand on IMSE 7750 business and technology plan into a business operation plan: advertising designs, facilities layout, selling and distribution channels, product designs, accounting procedures, manufacturing processes, and product prototypes.

courses.name: Entrepreneurial Innovation Management: Advanced Enterprise Operations
courses.description: Perform the day-to-day operations for an enterprise by managing all business processes including finance, manufacturing, sales, and delivery.

courses.name: Cognitive Ergonomics and Decision Making
courses.description: (cross-leveled with IMSE 4810). This course will cover the study of empirical research in cognitive ergonomics and Human-Computer Interaction (HCI). Students will learn cognitive information processing, mental workload, human reliability, decision-making, and empirical methods in HCI research. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Advanced Topics in Industrial & Manufacturing Systems Engineering
courses.description: Current and new technical developments in industrial engineering.

courses.name: Advanced Manufacturing and Supply Systems
courses.description: The design, regulation, and optimization of manufacturing and supply systems through systems analysis.

courses.name: Research Methods in Industrial & Manufacturing System Engineering
courses.description: Development of research approach. Selection of topic area including techniques of literature search with special emphasis on problem definition. Topics pertinent to planning, organizing and carrying out industrial engineering research or design project.

courses.name: Problems in Industrial and Manufacturing Systems Engineering
courses.description: Supervised investigation in industrial engineering to be presented in the form of an engineering report.

courses.name: Industrial Engineering Graduate Seminar
courses.description: Selected topics in industrial engineering; oral presentations and engineering reports. Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Engineering Experimentation
courses.description: Application of advanced statistical methods for the analysis of engineering design and experimental problems.

courses.name: Operations Research-Discrete Models
courses.description: Applications of discrete operations research methods, including linear programming, fuzzy sets, integer programming, and meta-heuristics.

courses.name: Nonlinear Optimization
courses.description: Introduces computational non-linear mathematical programming procedures their use in solving complex industrial systems design problems.

courses.name: Operations Research-Stochastic Models
courses.description: Theory and applications of stochastic processes; includes continuous time Markov chain, Markov decision process, queueing theory, and stochastic manufacturing systems.

courses.name: Advanced Systems Simulation
courses.description: Theory and practice of dynamic modeling and statistical experimentation.

courses.name: Advanced Integrated Production Systems
courses.description: Advanced study of the design and operation of flow shop, job shop, and cell-based production systems, including scheduling, layout and material flow issues.

courses.name: Supply Chain Modeling and Analysis
courses.description: Theory and application of supply chain networks, integration of production and inventory control methods.

courses.name: Advanced Management Information Systems Design
courses.description: Develops requirements for management information, staffing, cost estimating, evaluation, and the design of management communication systems; includes case studies.

courses.name: Advanced CAD/CAM
courses.description: Covers the state-of-the-art in CAD/CAM and explores the latest developments, residual problems, and new direction in CAD/CAM. Includes sculptured surface modeling, rapid prototyping and manufacturing, integrated process planning, shape analysis, machine intelligence.

courses.name: Advanced Quality Systems
courses.description: Advanced process control charts, empirical model-building, fractional factorial designs and Taguchi techniques as tools for process and product improvement, professional ethics in quality management; TQM and ISO 9000.

courses.name: Strategic Enterprise Management
courses.description: Topics including enterprise strategies, process and content models, strategy implementation, value chain analysis, business processes, systems engineering approaches, business process reengineering, and dynamic systems modeling.

courses.name: Human Factors
courses.description: Human factors inputs, outputs and environment and their influence on design and evaluation of man and machine systems.

courses.name: Health Care Systems Design and Analysis
courses.description: Health care systems design principles and major problems, basic organization within health care system, alternative system design strategies, factors affecting design process success.

courses.name: Research-Masters Thesis in Industrial Engineering
courses.description: Independent investigation in field of industrial engineering to be presented as a thesis. Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Advanced Linear Optimization
courses.description: Advanced study of linear programming, including optimization and its application including large-scale optimization, primal-dual methods, decomposition, interior point methods, convex analysis, and integer programming.

courses.name: Stochastic Service Systems
courses.description: Development and application of stochastic models in the design of service systems in which either demands for service or services supplies, or both, have a probabilistic nature.

courses.name: Dynamic Programming
courses.description: Introduces theory and computational aspects of dynamic programming; its application to sequential decision problems.
courses.prerequisites: IMSE 4210 or IMSE 7210 and IMSE 4230 or IMSE 7230

courses.name: Integer and Combinatorial Optimization
courses.description: Theory, solution methodology, and application of integer and sombinatorial optimization.

courses.name: Research-Doctoral Dissertation in Industrial Engineering
courses.description: Independent investigation in field of industrial engineering to be presented as a dissertation. Graded on S/U basis only.
